Algoriphagus alkaliphilus is also capable of hydrolyzing starch and casein, indicating its ability to produce extracellular enzymes.

Morphologically, Algoriphagus alkaliphilus cells are rod-shaped and approximately 0.3-0.5 μm in width and 1.0-3.0 μm in length. The cells are motile and possess gliding motility. The optimum growth temperature for this species is around 30°C.

Phylogenetic analyses based on 16S rRNA gene sequences have shown that Algoriphagus alkaliphilus is closely related to other members of the genus Algoriphagus, which are commonly found in various alkaline environments, such as soda lakes and saline soils.
